title: Ilfracombe to Combe Martin Walk Route

images.title: Barrie Cann / Beacon Point Ilfracombe, from Capstone, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Beacon Point Ilfracombe, from Capstone Beacon Point, just east of Ilfracombe, showing the rugged coastline of North Devon. The view is taken from near the top of Capstone Hill

images.title: Philip Halling / Bench and telescope, Capstone Point, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Bench and telescope, Capstone Point

images.title: Tony Atkin / Beacon Point, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Beacon Point. Beacon Point marks the northern side of Hillsborough Down where it juts out into the sea and can be seen in the midground of this photograph which was taken from the eastern side of Hele Bay looking over Beacon Point to Ilfracombe, which can be seen in the distance.

images.title: Grant Sherman / Rillage Point from Widmouth Head, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Rillage Point from Widmouth Head. Taken on the South West Coast path between Ilfracombe and Combe Martin. This footpath also forms part of the Tarka Trail.

images.title: Pauline Eccles / View from Haggington Point, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: View from Haggington Point, coastline towards Rillage Point. Limestone bands, containing fossils, including corals, fish fragments and marine invertebrates are especially prominent at Rillage.

images.title: Pauline Eccles [CC BY-SA 2.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Lester Point and Newberry Beach, Combe Martin The tide is in between the two features.

images.title: Pauline Eccles [CC BY-SA 2.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Telescope at Combe Martin. Looking towards Lester Cliff, with the telescope pointing towards Combe Martin Bay.

images.title: Tony Atkin [CC BY-SA 2.0 (https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0)], via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Combe Martin is said to have the longest village street in the country. This large village (or small town) is stretched out for two miles along a single road at the bottom of the valley. This photograph shows the north-western end of the village where it reaches the sea.

description: A popular coastal walk between these two North Devon settlements, using a section of the South West Coast Path. The route runs for a distance of about 5 miles so it's perfect for an afternoon walk. It's undulating path with some moderate climbs but with great views all the way from the elevated position of the cliff top path. The walk starts on the front in Ilfracombe and heads east past Capstone Point where there is a bench and a telescope to enjoy the view. You continue to Beacon Point which marks the northern side of Hillsborough Down and has nice views over Hele Bay. You continue past Samson's Bay and Widmouth Head before passing a series of caves on the outskirts of Combe Martin. The final section passes another fine viewpoint at Lester Point before coming into Combe Martin itself. To continue your walking in the area head east and visit The Hangman Hills where you can climb to the highest point on the South West Coast Path at Great Hangman. You could also explore the Heddon Valley with the climb giving great views back down to Combe Martin.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: The circular Ilfracombe to Lee Bay Walk heads west along the coast to Lee Bay before using the old Ilfracombe to Ossaborough Railway Path to return to Ilfracombe. It also visits the woodland trails in the Borough Valley between Lee and Ossaborough. From Ilfracombe you can catch a boat to the beautiful Lundy Island. The island is owned by the National Trust and has some splendid coastal walking trails. It's also a nature reserve with lots of wildlife to see, including the famous Lundy puffins. For more walking ideas in the area see the Exmoor Walks and North Devon Coast Walks pages.

display_address: Jubilee Gardens Pay & Display Car Park, Promenade, Ilfracombe, North Devon, Devon, England, EX34 9BZ, United Kingdom
